headline: EG Q4 Deep Dive: Portfolio Reshaping and Underwriting Discipline Offset by Market Headwinds
summary: Global reinsurance company Everest Group (NYSE:EG) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales falling 4.6% year on year to $4.42 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $13.26 per share was 4.1% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Everest Group Ltd (EG) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Navigating Challenges with Strategic Moves
summary: Despite a dip in gross written premiums, Everest Group Ltd (EG) showcases resilience with strong investment income and strategic share repurchases.

headline: Everest Q4 Earnings Miss, Revenues Top Estimates, Premiums Down Y/Y
summary: EG's Q4 results show a massive turnaround from last year's losses, fueled by a 19% jump in investment income despite a strategic pull-back in U.S. casualty lines.

headline: Everest Group (EG) Valuation Check After Flat Year And Recent Share Price Recovery
summary: Everest Group triggered overview Everest Group (EG) has recently drawn fresh attention after a period where returns have been mixed, with the stock roughly flat over the past year but showing a gain in the past 3 months. At a last close of $333.42 and annual revenue of US$17.7b alongside net income of US$547.0m, investors are assessing how consistent profitability and reinsurance exposure fit into their broader insurance holdings.
